bullet_summary: Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were also injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive

items.title: What we know about the Minnesota Catholic school shooter
items.standfirst: Investigators are still working to find a motive after a shooter opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis on Tuesday, killing two kids and wounding more than a dozen other people. CBS News senior coordinating producer for crime and public safety Anna Schecter has more.
items.content: Investigators are still working to find a motive after a shooter opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis on Tuesday, killing two kids and wounding more than a dozen other people. CBS News senior coordinating producer for crime and public safety Anna Schecter has more.

items.title: Here's what we know about the Minneapolis school shooting
items.standfirst: Investigators are examining the videos and writings of the shooter who fired through the windows of Annunciation Catholic Church, killing two children and wounding 18 people.
items.content: Investigators are examining the videos and writings of the shooter who fired through the windows of Annunciation Catholic Church, killing two children and wounding 18 people.

items.title: Mom was working in ICU when injured daughter arrived after school shooting
items.standfirst: One of the young victims of Wednesday's deadly mass shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school remains in critical condition Thursday, at the same hospital where her mother works as a pediatric critical care nurse.
items.content: One of the young victims of Wednesday's deadly mass shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school remains in critical condition Thursday, at the same hospital where her mother works as a pediatric critical care nurse.

items.title: Student shielding younger child took hit during school shooting, health official says

items.content: Officials provided updates on the medical conditions of 17 people injured during a school shooting in Minnesota. This comes as more details emerge about how teachers and students took cover as a shooter targeted the Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis on Wednesday.

items.title: 9-year old survivor recounts Minneapolis shooting, new details come out about shooter
items.standfirst: June Holine, a 9-year-old fourth grader, was inside Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis Wednesday when shots rang out. She tells CBS News about what she went through. Meanwhile, CBS News Justice correspondent Scott MacFarlane has the latest on the investigation into the shooting.

items.content: The shooter who killed 2 kids and injured 17 at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis had ties to the church where he targeted children celebrating a new school year during mass, CBS News' Anna Schecter reports.

The attacker barricaded at least two doors of the school's church from the outside before firing dozens…

items.title: Police say ‘countless lives’ saved during Minneapolis school shooting due to locked doors
items.standfirst: Shooter tried to enter church to carry out attack but failed since doors had been locked when mass began, officials sayAs Minneapolis grappled with the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school church in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, police said “countless lives” had been saved by the church doors being locked as the shooter had not been able to get inside.Two children, aged eight and 10, were killed in the church pews during morning mass at the Annunciation Catholic school church. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were also injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. Three adults, parishioners in their 80s, were also injured. Police said the suspected, Robin Westman, 23, killed themself and was found dead behind the church. Continue reading...
items.content: Shooter tried to enter church to carry out attack but failed since doors had been locked when mass began, officials sayAs Minneapolis grappled with the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school church in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, police said “countless lives” had been saved by the church doors being locked as the shooter had not been able to get inside.Two children, aged eight and 10, were killed in the church pews during morning mass at the Annunciation Catholic school church. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were also injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. Three adults, parishioners in their 80s, were also injured. Police said the suspected, Robin Westman, 23, killed themself and was found dead behind the church. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Fed’s Lisa Cook sues Trump over move to fire her

bullet_summary: Fed Governor Lisa Cook filed a lawsuit challenging what her suit said is President Trump's "unprecedented and illegal attempt to remove" her
The suit was widely expected, because Cook had already said she would not resign and had questioned the president's authority to fire her

clusters.title: Iran is facing a return of U.N. sanctions — what happens now?
clusters.neutral_headline: UK, France, Germany Seek to Reimpose Iran Sanctions
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, BBC World, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Iran is facing a return of U.N. sanctions — what happens now?
items.standfirst: Britain, France and Germany launched a 30-day process to reimpose U.N. sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme on Thursday, according to a letter sent by the three nations to the U.N.
items.content: Britain, France and Germany launched a 30-day process to reimpose U.N. sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme on Thursday, according to a letter sent by the three nations to the U.N.

items.title: UK, France and Germany move to reimpose UN sanctions on Iran
items.standfirst: The three powers trigger a process which could restore sanctions in 30 days, calling Iran's nuclear programme a threat to peace and security.
items.content: The three powers trigger a process which could restore sanctions in 30 days, calling Iran's nuclear programme a threat to peace and security.

items.title: Germany, France, UK trigger process to reimpose sanctions on Iran
items.standfirst: E3 countries accuse Iran of failing to meet its 2015 nuclear pact commitments but say they are still open to diplomacy.
items.content: E3 countries accuse Iran of failing to meet its 2015 nuclear pact commitments but say they are still open to diplomacy.

items.title: UK, France and Germany plan to reimpose sanctions on Iran over nuclear weapon fears
items.standfirst: The UK, France and Germany are planning to revive UN-backed sanctions on Iran over fears it is developing nuclear weapons.
items.content: The UK, France and Germany are planning to revive UN-backed sanctions on Iran over fears it is developing nuclear weapons.

items.title: Iran warns return of sanctions will ‘seriously undermine’ cooperation with UN nuclear watchdog
items.standfirst: Iran said the decision by Britain, France and Germany to launch a 30-day process to reimpose UN sanctions over its nuclear programme was a “provocative and unnecessary escalation” that would undermine the ongoing process of cooperation between Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
items.content: Iran said the decision by Britain, France and Germany to launch a 30-day process to reimpose UN sanctions over its nuclear programme was a “provocative and unnecessary escalation” that would undermine the ongoing process of cooperation between Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).

ai_summary: Britain, France, and Germany initiated a process to reimpose UN sanctions on Iran.
The three nations cited Iran's nuclear program as a threat to peace.
The process could restore sanctions within thirty days.
Iran warned the sanctions would undermine cooperation with the IAEA.
The E3 countries stated they remain open to diplomacy with Iran.

items.standfirst: The Victory Day parade in Beijing on 3 September will mark the formal surrender of Japan during the second world war. Top CDC officials resigned after the director was pushed out.

items.title: Cracker Barrel reverses course and will scrap new logo after intense backlash
items.standfirst: US restaurant chain previously said it would keep new logo despite some, including Trump and his son, criticizing itCracker Barrel, the 56-year-old US restaurant chain known for southern-style cooking, has reversed course and will scrap the new minimalist logo it launched just days ago after intense backlash.“We thank our guests for sharing your voices and love for Cracker Barrel. We said we would listen, and we have. Our new logo is going away and our ‘Old Timer’ will remain,” the company posted on social media, referring to the picture of the overall-clad man – known as “Uncle Herschel” – leaning against a barrel that had been its calling card for decades. Continue reading...
items.content: US restaurant chain previously said it would keep new logo despite some, including Trump and his son, criticizing itCracker Barrel, the 56-year-old US restaurant chain known for southern-style cooking, has reversed course and will scrap the new minimalist logo it launched just days ago after intense backlash.“We thank our guests for sharing your voices and love for Cracker Barrel. We said we would listen, and we have. Our new logo is going away and our ‘Old Timer’ will remain,” the company posted on social media, referring to the picture of the overall-clad man – known as “Uncle Herschel” – leaning against a barrel that had been its calling card for decades. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Cracker Barrel is scrapping its new logo.

clusters.title: UN Security Council votes to end peacekeeping force in Lebanon after 2026
clusters.neutral_headline: UN Security Council to End Lebanon Peacekeeping Force
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera

items.title: UN Security Council votes to end peacekeeping force in Lebanon after 2026
items.standfirst: Bowing to US and Israeli demands, the UN Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the multinational peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon. The resolution gives the force, known as UNIFIL, a year starting on Dec. 31, 2026, to withdraw its 10,800 military and civilian personnel and all UN equipment.
items.content: Bowing to US and Israeli demands, the UN Security Council voted unanimously on Thursday to terminate the multinational peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon. The resolution gives the force, known as UNIFIL, a year starting on Dec. 31, 2026, to withdraw its 10,800 military and civilian personnel and all UN equipment.

items.title: How hard will Trump’s 50% tariff hit India, and what is Delhi doing about it?
items.standfirst: Likened to a ‘trade embargo’ and an ‘earthquake’, it could cut exports from affected sectors by as much as 70%Donald Trump’s tariffs of 50% have come into force on most US imports from India. The US president followed through on his threat to punish one of the world’s largest economies for its purchases of discounted Russian oil. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump imposes 50% tariff on India as punishment for buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: US president has argued New Delhi indirectly helping fund Ukraine war as experts say move is ‘own goal’ against allyDonald Trump imposed 50% tariffs on most US imports from India, making good on a threat to punish one of the world’s largest economies over its purchases of discounted Russian oil.The tariffs, which came into effect just after midnight on Wednesday in Washington, risk inflicting significant damage on the Indian economy and further disrupting global supply chains. Continue reading...
items.content: US president has argued New Delhi indirectly helping fund Ukraine war as experts say move is ‘own goal’ against allyDonald Trump imposed 50% tariffs on most US imports from India, making good on a threat to punish one of the world’s largest economies over its purchases of discounted Russian oil.The tariffs, which came into effect just after midnight on Wednesday in Washington, risk inflicting significant damage on the Indian economy and further disrupting global supply chains. Continue reading...
